revised_title: Investigating the Chemical Induction of Melanism in Lepidoptera
tldr: The author analyzes experiments conducted on the moth Selenia bilunana to investigate the chemical induction of melanism. They find that the results do not support the hypothesis that lead treatment affects the mutation rate, and the data effectively excludes the possibility of a 10% mutation rate. The author also considers alternative hypotheses and discusses the implications of their findings on the understanding of melanism in lepidoptera.
